name: Bierzerkers
description: Fight and drink for the glory of Odin in Bierzerkers, a multiplayer melee arena combat game. While quick to pick up and get in some killing, the game has a great deal of depth, both individually and as a team.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: 2.0 GHz Dual-Core 64-bit CPU Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX11 Compatible GPU with 1 GB Video RAM Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 6 GB available space

Game is buggy and crashes a lot. However that's not the worst part. The game only features 5 classes right now and four of them are behind a paywall. What does that mean? All of your macthes are going to be nothing but the free class (Raider). This means after one match it gets silly and repetitive.   Horrible choice for the business model.

Update: This game now costs $5. I enjoyed this when it was free, but restricted.    Unfortunately, I cannot provide a good review for this one.  The game has ping issues at the time of this review's creation, so matchmaking can be troublesome. It is an easy 100% game, though. However, some of them are grindy.  The graphics and animation of this game remind me of Ubisoft's 'Mighty Quest for Epic Loot', not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing, but Huntress has a great ♥♥♥. So they have that going for them.   PROS:  Achievements Decent concept (I hear some compare this to rugby or football, which I know nothing about) Trailer animation looks good  CONS:  Pay for the other 4 classes Limited gameplay Kinda' boring  If you want something truly fun, you might want to look elsewhere. I can't see myself coming back to this game for any reason other than if new achievements were given to it.  3/10

Bierzerkers is an over-the-top pvp Viking-rugby game – with sheeps – by Shield Break Studios. If you haven’t figured out by now, the whole thing is a really silly take on the Vikings with probably all possible stereotypes. The whole craziness was why I installed it in the first place but soon realised that things aren't as great as they may look after watching the trailer: The game unfortunately is standing with one foot in the grave.
